intro: Trymalium oligocephalum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flax. It is a flowering plant native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in loose inflorescences. Trymalium oligocephalum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
